february.title: Reporting -  Partial degraded performance
services: Settlement Detail Report Payment Accounting Report Received Payment Details Report Interactive Payment Accounting Report Dispute Report
february.raw:
Resolved(The technical issue affecting report generation has been resolved and report processing times have returned to normal. The remaining report request queue will process in the coming hours.  Merchants listening to notifications will be able to download reports once they receive the REPORT_AVAILABLE notification.  Please follow updates through our Status page (www.adyen.com/status).)
Updated(Our engineering team continues to work on expediting the generation of the affected reports.  As previously mentioned, manually generated reports as well as the following scheduled reports may be affected by this generation delay:  - Payment accounting report- Received payment details report- Interactive payment accounting report- Dispute report  In the case of automatically generated reports, it is not required to manually request reports from our Customer Area. Merchants listening to notifications will be able to download the reports once they receive the REPORT_AVAILABLE notification.  Please follow updates through our Status page (www.adyen.com/status).)
Identified(We have identified an issue affecting report generation starting on February 7th, 2023.  Our engineering team is engaged in actively monitoring the situation and is continuing to work on expediting the generation of the reports.  Manually generated reports as well as the following scheduled reports may be affected by this generation delay:  - Settlement Detail Report- Payment Accounting Report- Received Payment Details Report- Interactive Payment Accounting Report- Dispute Report  In the case of automatically generated reports, it is not required to manually request reports from our Customer Area. Merchants listening to notifications will be able to download the reports once they receive the REPORT_AVAILABLE notification.  Please follow updates through our Status page (www.adyen.com/status).)

february.title: Unbooked Transaction Processing Fees in Settlement Detail Report
february.raw:
Resolved(The earlier reported issue on unbooked Transaction Processing Fees in the Settlement Detail Report has been identified and is now resolved.  Transactions Fees that were not previously deducted will be deducted from the next scheduled Payable batch. Both merchants on Sales Day Payout and Pass Through Payouts will have the corresponding Settlement Detail Reports for their next scheduled batch including all related Transaction Fees.  If you have further questions, please contact Adyen support.)
Updated(Please find a correction to the system message that was sent earlier titled “Settlement Detail Report Data Quality and Incorrect Payout Sums Issue”:  Due to an ongoing issue, a subset of Transaction Fees have not yet been deducted from reported settlements since January 25th, 2023.  Settlement Detail Reports and corresponding payouts to merchants since January 25th, 2023 are correct.  Adyen is working to resolve this issue. Upon resolution, Transaction Fees that have not yet been deducted since January 25th will be included and deducted from future batches and will be listed in the Settlement Detail Reports corresponding to those future batches.  We will provide an update as soon as it becomes available.  If you have further questions, please contact Adyen support.)
Identified(Due to an ongoing issue, a subset of Settlement Detail Reports generated as of January 25th, 2023 have been generated with incomplete data with missing fee deductions.  As a result of this issue, the corresponding payouts to merchants since January 25th, 2023 had incorrectly larger sums.  Our engineering team is engaged in resolving the issue affecting the Settlement Detail Reports.  We will provide an update as soon as it becomes available.  If you have further questions, please contact Adyen support.)

march.title: Amex - No authentication for PSD2 AMEX traffic
march.raw:
Resolved(All traffic has now been routed back through the In-App Mobile Native flow. We will continue to monitor performance.  As of now this incident is considered resolved.  Please follow new updates through our Status Page (status.adyen.com).)
Updated(We have received confirmation from Amex that the root issue has been resolved. We are now routing traffic back through the In-App Mobile Native flow and will continue to monitor performance.  Please follow new updates through our Status Page (status.adyen.com).)
Updated(We continue to work on resolving this issue.  It is further identified that that the issue is isolated to Amex 3DS2 In-App traffic (ie. mobile native challenge traffic) only.  In order to alleviate further impact of traffic, our engineers have re-routed traffic from In-App Mobile Native to 3DS2 Redirect browser flow as of 15:20 CEST on March 31st, 2023.  Please note that Amex 3DS2 browser is not impacted by this issue.  Please follow new updates through our Status Page (status.adyen.com).)

 We will provide a new update within 60 minutes.

)

may.title: Verifone - Payment initiation issue affecting Standalone and Pay-at-table transactions starting at 08:24 CEST
may.raw:
Resolved(The issue with initiation of transactions on Standalone or Pay-at-table devices has been resolved as of 19:16 CEST.  The issue was caused by a missing button making the initiation of Standalone or Pay-at-table transactions not possible for terminals that carried out a configuration update after the issue started.  Please update the terminal configuration of your device manually to resolve the issue on your device effective immediately. You can follow the instructions on our docs page to manually update the configuration:  https://docs.adyen.com/point-of-sale/managing-terminals/maintain-performance#update-the-configuration-manually Once the configuration update is initiated, the device will retrieve the updated configuration and restart the Adyen app. The update should take around 1-2 minutes to complete.  Alternatively, you can wait for the automatic reboot to update the configuration which generally happens around 04:00 local time of the terminal.  In case of questions, please contact https://help.adyen.com/contact.  Please follow new updates through our Status Page (status.adyen.com).)
Identified(We have identified an issue resulting in the initiation of transactions failing for terminals using Standalone or Pay-at-table mode starting at 08:24 CEST.  Specifically, the Standalone and Pay-at-table buttons are missing from the terminals.  Our engineering team is engaging in urgently resolving the issue.  In the meantime, merchants can initiate Standalone transactions via the transaction menu by selecting 8 + GREEN, entering the transaction menu PIN and selecting “normal payment”.  We will share an update as soon as more information becomes available.  Please follow new updates through our Status Page (status.adyen.com).)

may.raw:

We are seeing improvements on the following services:

- As of 13:58 CEST, Customer Area TEST and payment processing in TEST is available once again.

- As of 14:15 CEST, performance has returned to normal for requests sent to our Adyen for Platform endpoints.

- As of 13:53 CEST, we are seeing improvements in the processing of modifications as our system continues to work through the backlog.

We continue to review potential impact on additional services across our platform and will provide a new update as soon as it becomes available.)
Updated(We continue working on resolving the external issue that is currently resulting in degraded performance in our platform.

We are seeing improvements on the following services:

- As of 13:35 CEST, Customer Area LIVE is available once again.

- As of 13:44 CEST, we are starting to see improvements on requests sent to our Adyen for Platform endpoints.

We continue to see performance issues on the following services:

- For all regions: Processing of modifications sent as of 12:11 CEST continue being processed with an increased delay.

- For all regions: Customer Area TEST and payment processing in TEST continues to be unavailable.

We continue to review potential impact on additional services across our platform and will provide a new update in the next 30 minutes.)
Updated(We continue working on resolving the external issue that is currently resulting in degraded performance in our platform.

As a result of this issue, we are still observing the following performance issues:

- For all regions: Requests for Adyen for Platform endpoints continue to return errors and merchants may still see increased latency for these requests.

- For all regions: Processing of modifications sent as of 12:11 CEST continue being processed with a delay.

- For all regions: Payment list view as well as other features of the Customer Area LIVE and TEST continue to be unavailable.

We will provide a new update in the next 15 minutes.)
Updated(We continue working on resolving the external issue that is currently resulting in degraded performance in our platform.

As a result of this issue, we are still observing the following impact:

- For all regions: Processing of modifications sent as of 12:11 CEST continue being processed with a delay.

- For all regions: Requests for Adyen for Platform endpoints will be returning errors and merchants will see increased latency for these requests.

- For all regions: Payment list view as well as other features of the Customer Area LIVE and TEST are currently unavailable.

We will provide a new update in the next 15 minutes.)
Updated(We continue working on resolving the external issue that is currently resulting in degraded performance in our platform.

As of 12:45 CEST we are seeing a complete recovery in the response times and error rate of our European endpoints as well as for our recurring and tokenization service globally.

As a result of this issue, we are still observing the following impact:

- For all regions: Processing of modifications sent as of 12:11 CEST are being processed with a delay.

- For all regions: Requests for Adyen for Platform endpoints will be returning errors and merchants will see increased latency for these requests.

- For all regions: Payment list view as well as other features of the Customer Area are currently unavailable.

We will provide a new update in the next 15 minutes.)
Updated(We continue working on resolving the external issue that is currently resulting in degraded performance for our European endpoints.

As of 12:35 CEST we start to see recovery in the response times and error rate of our European endpoints as well as for our recurring and tokenization service globally.

As a result of this issue, we are still observing the following impact:

- European endpoints: Payment processed for merchants connecting to our European endpoints continues to recover back to its normal levels. 

- For all regions: Synchronous processing of recurring reference for shopper sign-ups, payments making use of tokens and operations used to store or modify tokenized payment credentials continues to recover back to its normal levels.

- For all regions: Processing of modifications sent as of 12:11 CEST are being processed with a delay.

We will provide a new update in the next 15 minutes.

Previous updates have been posted in our status page only as performance of Customer Area was degraded up to this point. )

july.title: Unavailability of new payment method setup
july.raw:
Resolved(The issues impacting the request and activation for payment methods via API (Management API - paymentMethodSettings) and Customer Area ("Setup payment methods" page) have been resolved.  Merchants can request new payment methods on their accounts through API and Customer Area again.)
Identified(We have identified an issue impacting the request and activation for payment methods via API (Management API - paymentMethodSettings) and Customer Area ("Setup payment methods" page) starting 09:50 CEST. In the meantime, you can reach out to Adyen support via help.adyen.com/contact to request help setting up new payment methods on your account.  Please follow new updates through our Status Page (https://status.adyen.com).)

july.title: HDFC Bank - Scheduled Maintenance
july.raw:
Resolved(The scheduled maintenance for HDFC Bank has completed.

We have observed transaction processing back to normal. We will continue to monitor and issue an update if needed.

Please follow new updates through our Status Page (https://status.adyen.com).
)
Identified(HDFC Bank is performing a scheduled maintenance activity for HDFC UPI transactions.

As a result, payment processing for HDFC transactions may be intermittently disrupted during this maintenance window and an increased of refusals might be experienced.

Date and Time (CET):  July 28th, 20:30 CET
Duration: Approximately 3H 30Minutes

We will provide an update when we receive confirmation that the maintenance has concluded.

Please follow new updates through our Status Page (https://status.adyen.com).)

september.title: Degraded performance for non-payments services in EU region as of 08:55 CEST
september.raw:
Resolved(We can now confirm that the issue resulting in degraded performance for several services across our platform is now fully resolved.  Report generation delays have gone back to normal levels and our engineers are working on expediting the generation of the remaining delayed reports.  We will continue monitoring and provide any new updates, if necessary.)
Updated(We continue working on completely resolving the issue resulting in degraded performance for a subset of non-payments services for merchants in our EU region.  We are seeing a complete recovery in the response times and error rate of the following services:- Idempotency services experienced degraded performance between 08:55 and 08:57 CEST. Any failed requests during this timeframe can be retried with the same idempotency key.- Payments list and case management experienced degraded performance between 08:55 and 09:17 CEST.- Delays in modification processing have recovered as of 10:26 CEST.  As a result of this issue, we are still observing the following impact:- Delays in the generation of several reports such as Payment Accounting Report, Settlement Details Report, Received Payment Details Report.  In the case of automatically generated reports or reports requested via the Customer Area, it is not required to manually request reports again. Merchants listening to notifications will be able to download the reports once they receive the REPORT_AVAILABLE notification.  Please note that payment processing is not impacted by this issue.We will provide an update within the next 30 minutes.  You can also follow future updates through our status page (https://status.adyen.com))
Updated(We continue working on completely resolving the issue resulting in degraded performance for a subset of non-payments services for merchants in our EU region.  We are seeing a complete recovery in the response times and error rate of the following services:- Idempotency services experienced degraded performance between 08:55 and 08:57 CEST.- Payments list and case management experienced degraded performance between 08:55 and 09:17 CEST.  As a result of this issue, we are still observing the following impact:- Modification for a subset of payments may experience slight delaysPlease note that payment processing is not impacted by this issue.We will provide an update within the next 30 minutes.  You can also follow future updates through our status page (https://status.adyen.com).)
Identified(We have identified an issue starting at 08:55 CEST causing degraded performance for a subset of non-payments services for merchants in our EU region.As a result of this issue, we are observing impact in the following services:- Idempotency services may experience degraded performance- Modification may experience slight delays- Payments list and case management may experience degraded performance  Our engineering team has taken mitigative actions and we can see that performance has improved as of 09:06 CEST.  Please note that payment processing is not impacted by this issue.We will provide an update in 30 minutes.  You can also follow future updates through our status page (https://status.adyen.com).)

october.title: Adyen Mastercard and Visa Singapore - Elevated Error Rate
october.raw:
Resolved(The external issue resulting in increased refusal rates for the issuers DBS BANK LTD and CITIBANK SINGAPORE LIMITED is now confirmed to be resolved. We see an improvement in authorisation rates for Visa and Mastercard transactions through these issuers since 15:40 CEST.  We will continue monitoring and provide any updates, if necessary.  Please follow new updates through our Status Page (https://status.adyen.com).)
Updated(As of 13:56 CEST, our engineering team completed the mitigation actions for the external issue that resulted in degraded performance in our platform in the APAC region. We will continue monitoring and provide any updates, if necessary.  We continue to observe:- elevated refusal rate for Visa and Mastercard transactions for Singapore issuer DBS BANK LTD- improvements in authorisation rates for Visa and Mastercard transactions for Singapore issuer CITIBANK SINGAPORE LIMITED.  We will provide an update as soon as it becomes available. You can also follow future updates through our status page (https://status.adyen.com).)
Updated(We continue being engaged on mitigating the external issue that is currently resulting in degraded performance in our platform in the APAC region.  As a result of this issue, we continue to observe elevated refusal rate for Visa and Mastercard transactions for Singapore issuer DBS BANK LTD, for which an internal system outage has been confirmed by Visa. Their teams are working on fixing the issue.  Since 13:30 CEST processing Visa and Mastercard transactions with Singapore issuer CITIBANK SINGAPORE LIMITED has improved significantly.  We will provide an update within the next hour. You can also follow future updates through our status page (https://status.adyen.com))
Updated(We continue being engaged on mitigating the external issue that is currently resulting in degraded performance in our platform in the APAC region.  Since 10:55 CEST we are seeing a complete recovery in Modification delays.  As a result of this issue, we continue to observe elevated refusal rate for Visa and Mastercard transactions for Singapore issuers:- DBS BANK LTD- CITIBANK SINGAPORE LIMITED.  We have contacted Visa and Mastercard and will provide an update within the next hour. You can also follow future updates through our status page (https://status.adyen.com).)
Updated(We continue being engaged on mitigating the external issue that is currently resulting in degraded performance in our platform in the APAC region.  As a result, we continue to observe performance issues for Visa and Mastercard transactions for Singapore issuers:- DBS BANK LTD- CITIBANK SINGAPORE LIMITED.  We will provide an update in 30 minutes. You can also follow future updates through our status page (https://status.adyen.com).)
Updated(Due to an external issue starting at 09:35 CEST, we are currently experiencing degraded performance in our platform for merchants connecting to our APAC endpoints.  As a result of this issue, we are observing impact in the following services:  - Modification delays from 09:35 CEST to 10:55 CEST.- Processing of Visa and Mastercard transactions through Singapore Issuers.  Our engineering team has been engaged and is urgently working together to resolve this issue.  We will provide an update in 30 minutes. You can also follow future updates through our status page (https://status.adyen.com))
Identified(We have identified an issue on our platform resulting in an elevated error rate for transactions processed through Adyen Mastercard and Visa in Singapore starting at 09:10 CEST.  We are investigating the cause and our engineering team is engaged to find a solution.  Please follow new updates through our Status Page (https://status.adyen.com).)

january.title: Sofort – Increased amount of chargebacks for transactions processed between January 8th and January 10th, 2022
january.raw:
Resolved(The issue resulting in an increase of chargebacks for transactions processed through Sofort has now been resolved.  In our previous message we have incorrectly stated that the issue was not resolved.  Sparkassen, AT Raiffeisen and DKB have been re-enabled in the list of Sofort banks available to complete transactions.  Settlement flows so that Sofort transactions have also been returned to its original configuration.  If you have additional questions, please visit support.adyen.com)
Resolved(The issue resulting in an increase of chargebacks for transactions processed through Sofort has not been resolved.  Sparkassen, AT Raiffeisen and DKB have been re-enabled in the list of Sofort banks available to complete transactions.  Settlement flows so that Sofort transactions have also been returned to its original configuration.  If you have additional questions, please visit support.adyen.com)
Updated(We wanted to share with you an update regarding the external issue resulting in an increase of chargebacks for transactions processed through Sofort.  Our engineering team has identified that the issue relates to an external technical problem in the settlement of funds for Sofort transactions.  The issue seems to mainly impact three issuing banks within the Sofort network: Sparkassen, AT Raiffeisen and DKB.  As a result, transactions sent for processing between January 8th and January 11th have now been booked to Chargeback as the funds have not yet been received by Adyen.  To mitigate any further impact, Adyen and Sofort have taken the following steps effective as of today, January 22nd at 16:30 CET:  - Sofort has temporarily removed Sparkassen, AT Raiffeisen and DKB from the list of banks available to complete transactions. The banks will be re-enabled in the list once the issue is resolved.- Adyen has temporarily modified its settlement flows so that Sofort transactions are no longer incorrectly booked to Chargeback.  We will make sure to share further information once it becomes available.  If you have additional questions, please visit support.adyen.com)
Identified(We have identified a technical issue resulting in an increase of chargebacks for transactions processed through Sofort between January 8th and January 10th, 2022.  Our engineering team is currently working with Sofort to identify the root cause of the issue. We will make sure to share further information once it becomes available.  If you have additional questions, please visit support.adyen.com)

january.title: Adyen - Unscheduled maintenance - Monday January 10th 2022
january.raw:
Resolved(The short unscheduled maintenance has been completed.  The Customer Area (ca-live.adyen.com) is available once again, and all functionality has been restored.)
Identified(Adyen will perform a short unscheduled maintenance as part of the weekly platform update. This maintenance will be shorter than usual and is expected to last for only 15 minutes.  During the maintenance window, access to the Customer Area (ca-live.adyen.com) will be temporarily unavailable and modifications (such as refunds, captures and third-party payouts) will be processed with a delay.  Additionally, reports will be generated with a delay for the duration of the maintenance window.  Payment processing will be unaffected by this maintenance.  For further updates please refer to the Status Page (www.adyen.com/status).)

april.title: Partial report generation delay on April 25th 2022
april.raw:
Resolved(As of 13:00 CEST April 28th 2022, our system has recovered from the partial report generation delay affecting a number of automatically scheduled reports and manually requested reports via our Customer Area.  If you have additional questions, please visit support.adyen.com)
Updated(Our system continues to recover from the partial report generation delay affecting a number of automatically scheduled reports and manually requested reports via our Customer Area.  Our engineering team continues monitoring the situation and will continue working expediting the generation of the affected reports.  As previously mentioned, the following reports are affected by this generation delay:- Payments accounting report- Received payments report- Dispute report- ThreeDSecure authentication report- ThreeDSecure conversion report  In the case of automatically generated reports, it is not required to manually request reports from our Customer Area.  Once the report is available for download, we will send a server-to-server notification with eventCode=REPORT_AVAILABLE. At that moment, the report will also be available for download from the Finance section in the Customer Area.  Please follow new updates through our Status page (www.adyen.com/status).)
Identified(We are currently experiencing a partial report generation delay for a number of automatically scheduled reports and manually requested reports via our Customer Area.  The following reports will therefore experience a generation delay:- Payments accounting report- Received payments report- Dispute report- ThreeDSecure authentication report- ThreeDSecure conversion report  In the case of automatically generated reports, it is not required to manually request reports from our Customer Area.  Once the report is available for download, we will send a server-to-server notification with eventCode=REPORT_AVAILABLE. At that moment, the report will also be available for download from the Finance section in the Customer Area.  We will make sure to send a follow-up update reporting on the progress this afternoon.  Please follow new updates through our Status page (www.adyen.com/status).)

Merchants who have automatic report generation enabled in the Customer Area (ca-live.adyen.com) will have to re-download the report once the REPORT_AVAILABLE notification has been received.  Merchants who use manual generation and have automatic generation disabled in the Customer Area will have to regenerate and re-download the report once a system message confirming the issue has been resolved has been posted.  We will provide frequent updates on the progress throughout the day.  Please continue to follow new updates through our Status Page (www.adyen.com/status).)
Updated(Update on timing - report generation is expected to begin tomorrow, June 1st.  Additional updates will be communicated here and can be found at: adyen.com/status  Please also note- no action is necessary to generate reports. Scheduled reports will process automatically, as normal, but with a delay.)
Identified(Due to an issue that is currently being resolved, the Monthly Finance Report (MFR) for June 1st, 2022, will not be generated on the regular schedule.  This is due to a data quality issue and Adyen engineers are working to reprocess the missing data in order to generate complete reports.  As this is an intensive process we currently do not have an exact estimated time of generation for the MFR, however as soon as this becomes available we will post an additional system message.  Once re-generation has been requested, merchants listening to notifications will receive notifications with event code “REPORT_AVAILABLE” as soon as the reports are available for download.  Please visit support.adyen.com in case you have additional questions.)

Resolved(Our engineering team has been engaged and performance has been restored. We will continue monitoring the situation closely in the event that further intervention is required.  We will keep you informed via system message or via our status page (www.adyen.com/status) in the case of any required updates.)
Identified(We have identified an issue starting at 09:55 CEST resulting in performance degradation for Adyen for Platforms.  Requests to CAL endpoints are intermittently returning errors and merchants may notice increased latency for these requests.  Our engineering team has been engaged and is urgently working on resolving this issue.  Please follow new updates through our Status Page (www.adyen.com/status).)

june.title: Degraded Platform due to Cloudflare outage
june.raw:
Resolved(The performance of various local payment methods affected by the outage has returned to normal since 09:05 CEST. Adyen Support is reachable and replies are possible once again.  We are continuing to monitor and provide further updates if required.  Please follow new updates through our Status Page (www.adyen.com/status).)
Identified(As a result of an outage on external CDN provider Cloudflare, we are noticing degraded performance for various local payment methods, including iDEAL, Molpay, and Afterpay Touch. Additionally, due to this issue, Adyen Support is currently unable to reply to support emails.  For status updates you may follow: https://www.cloudflarestatus.com/incidents/xvs51y9qs9dj Adyen will update the system message as soon as we have further updates (https://www.adyen.com/status).)

june.title: Delay in email delivery
june.raw:
Resolved(The identified issue affecting the delivery of e-mails originating from the ‘adyen.com' domain servers has been resolved today as of 14:30 CEST. This included, but was not limited to, password resets, Pay-by-Link and local payment methods confirmation e-mails.  Our systems are currently clearing the queue of delayed e-mails scheduled before 14:30 CEST. New e-mails sent from this time onwards are unaffected by this issue.  We will continue monitoring and provide an update if required.)
Identified(We have identified an issue affecting the delivery of email originating from the adyen.com domain servers starting 17:30 CEST, June 13th. As a result, a subset of emails originating from Adyen could be received with a delay. This includes, but is not limited to, emails related to password resets, Pay by Link, and confirmation emails for local payment methods.  Our engineering team has been engaged and is working on resolving the issue. We will provide an update as soon as it becomes available.  Please follow new updates through our Status Page (www.adyen.com/status).)

july.title: Idempotency - errors between 13:40 and 15:35 CEST in EU region
july.raw:
Resolved(We can confirm that performance for our idempotency service in the EU region has recovered as of 15:35 CEST.For requests that have not been successfully processed, we recommend merchants to retry them with the same idempotency key.We will continue to monitor the situation closely and provide a new update if required. Please follow new updates through our Status page (www.adyen.com/status).)
Updated(Our engineering team has identified the root cause and connectivity to the EU endpoints for idempotent requests has recovered as of 15:35 CEST.We will continue monitoring and will provide an update in the next 30 minutes.Please follow new updates through our Status page (www.adyen.com/status).)
Updated(We continue experiencing issues for merchants connecting to EU endpoints. Our engineering team is urgently working to resolve this issue.We will provide a new update in the next 30 minutes.Please follow new updates through our Status page (www.adyen.com/status).)
Identified(We are currently experiencing degraded performance for our idempotency service in the EU region since 13:40 CEST. As a result, merchants using this service may be seeing an elevated error rate for idempotent calls.Our technical teams are actively working on urgently resolving this issue.We will provide a new update in the next 30 minutes.Please follow new updates through our Status page (www.adyen.com/status).)

october.title: Reporting & Payouts - Degraded Performance
october.raw:
Resolved(The technical issue has been resolved and payouts scheduled on Friday October 28th, 2022 have been reprocessed.  Settlement Detail reports are available for download and all other reports continue to be generated. Merchants listening to notifications will be able to download the reports once they receive the REPORT_AVAILABLE notification.  Please visit support.adyen.com in case of any questions.)

We will provide regular updates on the status of reprocessing payouts and generating reports.)

november.title: Delayed Response Time for Support Requests
november.raw:
Resolved(The reported issue with our ticket/contact system has been resolved since 14:30 CET.  We will continue monitoring the situation and provide a new update if required.  Please follow new updates through our Status Page (www.adyen.com/status).)
Updated(Adyen engineers have deployed a preliminary fix for the intermittent issue with our ticket/contact system. We have observed an improvement in performance of the affected system.  We will continue to monitor and provide a subsequent update upon full resolution of the issue via our Status Page (www.adyen.com/status).)
Identified(We have identified an intermittent issue with our ticket/contact system which may prevent merchants from being able to contact us through support@adyen.com and other email channels.  This issue does not affect the Customer Area support ticket creation page. Please log in to the Customer Area and use the below link in case you need to contact Adyen Support:https://ca-live.adyen.com/ca/ca/contactUs/support.shtml Merchants might experience delayed responses to their support requests as a result.  We will provide an update in 30 minutes via our Status Page (www.adyen.com/status).)

november.title: Reporting - Degraded Performance
november.raw:
Resolved(The technical issue affecting report generation has been resolved and report processing times have returned to normal. The remaining report request queue will process in the coming hours.  Merchants listening to notifications will be able to download reports once they receive the REPORT_AVAILABLE notification.  Please visit support.adyen.com in case of any questions.)
Updated(We have identified an issue affecting report generation on November 9th, 2022.  Our engineering team is actively monitoring the situation and is continuing to work on expediting the generation of the affected reports.  Manually generated reports as well as the the following scheduled reports are affected by this generation delay:- Payment accounting report- Received payment details report- Interactive payment accounting report- Dispute report  In the case of automatically generated reports, it is not required to manually request reports from our Customer Area. Merchants listening to notifications will be able to download the reports once they receive the REPORT_AVAILABLE notification.  Please follow updates through our Status page (www.adyen.com/status).)
Resolved(The technical issue has been resolved and report generation is back to normal  Settlement Detail reports are available for download and all other reports continue to be generated. Merchants listening to notifications will be able to download the reports once they receive the REPORT_AVAILABLE notification.  Please visit support.adyen.com in case of any questions.)
Identified(We have identified an issue affecting report generation on Wednesday November 9th, 2022.  Our engineering team has been engaged and is urgently working on resolving this issue.  Further details will be shared as they become available.  We will provide regular updates on the status of generating reports.)

december.title: Adyen - Test environment maintenance (Wednesday December 14th, 2022)
december.raw:
Resolved(The internal maintenance in TEST environment was successfully completed at 09:45 CET on December 14th.  We will continue monitoring and provide a new update if required.  Please follow new updates through our Status Page (www.adyen.com/status).)
Identified(Adyen is performing an internal maintenance in TEST environment as of 09:20 CET on December 14th.  During this period the TEST environment will run at reduced capacity.  Merchants may experience partial degraded performance of Customer Area on TEST including:  - (partial) unavailability of Customer Area- (partial) unavailability of Payment list and Case management pages- Search not returning results- modifications (such as refunds, captures and third-party payouts) being processed with a delay  Payment processing will be unaffected by this maintenance.  We will continue monitoring and will provide an update once the maintenance is over.  Please follow new updates through our Status Page (www.adyen.com/status).)

january.title: WeChat Pay and Alipay - Executive order issued January 5th 2021
january.raw:
Resolved(In reference to the system messages in January 2021 regarding payment processing for Alipay and WeChatPay, The United States issued an Executive Order on June 9th, 2021 revoking the prior Executive Orders impacting Alipay and WeChat Pay.  Further details can be found at: https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2021/06/11/2021-12506/protecting-americans-sensitive-data-from-foreign-adversaries Additionally, the Secretary of Commerce has rescinded the Identification of Prohibited Transactions with respect to TikTok and the Identification of Prohibited Transactions with respect to WeChat. The US government is continuing to evaluate on an ongoing basis.  We do not expect further developments on this topic, and will only provide updates if new government action is taken.  As before, we will continue to process Alipay and WeChat Pay under our standard terms and conditions.)
Resolved(The United States issued an Executive Order impacting Alipay and WeChat Pay on January 5th, 2021.  The order could go into effect after 45 days, on February 19th. We are waiting on the US Secretary of Commerce for further guidance on the implications for the use of Alipay and WeChat Pay in the US, and by persons and companies under jurisdiction of US law.  Until clarification is provided we will continue to process Alipay and WeChat Pay under our standard terms and conditions.  For further information on the order please see:https://trumpwhitehouse.archives.gov/presidential-actions/executive-order-addressing-threat-posed-applications-software-developed-controlled-chinese-companies/ We will update you once we have more information.)

january.title: 3DS1 intermittent issue in Spain
january.raw:
Updated(We are continuing to see 3DS1 intermittent errors in Spain (ES).  Redsys (ACS) acknowledge the issue and confirm that transaction having such behaviour is happening on authentication cancelled.In this use case Redsys (ACS) is not creating the necessary information (PaRes) to complete successfully the transaction.  Please contact Adyen Support (support@adyen.com) in case you have any questions.)
Updated(We are continuing to see 3DS1 intermittent errors in Spain (ES).  We are in contact with Redsys and we will provide an update as soon as it becomes available.  Please contact Adyen Support (support@adyen.com) in case you have any questions.)
Identified(We have identified an issue outside of our platform resulting in 3DS1 intermittent errors in Spain (ES).  For some 3DS1 authentications, the ACS is not sending the appropriate key-value pair back to the merchant's termUrl causing failure to validate the given authentication.  We are currently seeing "AutRes" & "message_format" returned when "MD" & "PaRes" is expected.  We have contacted Redsys and we will provide an update as soon as it becomes available.  Please contact Adyen Support (support@adyen.com) in case you have any questions.)

february.title: Adyen - Issues in the processing of RevenueProtect and Tokenisation requests processed in Europe
february.raw: Identified(Due to an issue that has now been resolved, we experienced an increased amount of errors in the processing of Tokenisation and RevenueProtect requests processed in Europe between 14:54 CET and 15:45 CET.Merchants can now resubmit unsuccessful tokenisation requests for processing.Affected requests processed through Adyen’s RevenueProtect service may have experienced degraded performance in the execution ShopperDNA, velocity risk checks, custom risk rules and external risk checks.Please contact Adyen Support (support@adyen.com) in case you have any questions.)

Resolved(The issue affecting the delayed generation of automatically scheduled reports and manually requested reports via our Customer Area has now been resolved.In the case of automatically schedule reports, we will send a server-to-server notification with eventCode=REPORT_AVAILABLE once a report is available for download within the Finance section in the Customer Area.)
Identified(We are currently experiencing an issue resulting in a generation delay for automatically scheduled reports and manually requested reports via our Customer Area.In the case of automatically generated reports, it is not required to manually request reports from our Customer Area.Once the report is available for download, we will send a server-to-server notification with eventCode=REPORT_AVAILABLE. At that moment, the report will also be available for download from the Finance section in the Customer Area. We will provide a further update at 14:00 CEST.Please contact Adyen Support (support@adyen.com) in case you have additional questions.)

services: Impacted PayPal Products APIs Express Checkout Online Checkout Homepage Account

april.title: Intermittent connectivity issues starting at 09:23 CEST
april.raw:
Resolved(This incident can be considered resolved. Network instability has recovered as of 09:37 CEST.  Our technical teams continue to monitor the situation and we will update you further should it be necessary.  Please contact Adyen Support (support@adyen.com) in case you have additional questions.)
Updated(The reported DDOS attack has subsided. Network instability has recovered as of 09:37 CEST.  We continue monitoring the situation closely and will close the incident in the next 15 minutes if there are no updates.  Please contact Adyen Support (support@adyen.com) in case you have additional questions.)
Identified(We have detected a DDOS attack on our systems that may result in occasional connectivity issues and degraded performance starting at 09:23 CEST.  We have activated our DDOS mitigation strategy. We will continue to work to contain the impact and monitor the situation.  We will keep you informed of any updates via this page (www.adyen.com/status).)

june.title: Notifications/Webhooks - Incomplete data
june.raw:
Resolved(The issue affecting our webhooks/notification service has been resolved as of 08:00 CEST.  This issue impacted notifications for some transactions using Real Time Account Updater. Impacted notifications which included the value "null\/null" for the expiryDate field are not able to be re-sent. Merchants who are experiencing issues consuming these notifications should temporarily adjust their logic to allow the expiryDate field to contain a “null” value.  API responses were not affected by this issue.  Please contact Adyen Support (support@adyen.com) in case you have additional questions.)
Identified(We are aware of an issue affecting our webhooks/notification service starting at 12:31 CEST on Friday June 25th. As a result, some merchants making use of our notification service may be receiving notifications with incomplete data.  More specifically, notifications for some transactions using Real Time Account Updater with eventCode AUTHORISATION were sent with value "null\/null" for the expiryDate field.  Our engineering team has been engaged and is actively working in resolving the situation.  We will provide a new update as soon it becomes available.  Please contact Adyen Support (support@adyen.com) in case you have additional questions.)

june.title: Issue affecting automated captures - June 1st
june.raw:
Resolved(We have now successfully recaptured the transactions affected by the automated capture issue reported on June 1st.Please contact Adyen Support (support@adyen.com) in case you have additional questions.)
Updated(At 15:00 CEST on June 2nd we have started recapturing the transactions affected by the reported issue with automated captures on June 1st.This automated process will gradually capture the affected authorisations. We currently expect it to complete before midnight CEST.We will provide new updates as soon as they become available.Please contact Adyen Support (support@adyen.com) in case you have additional questions.)
Identified(We have identified an issue affecting automated captures processed between 10:55 and 14:29 CEST on June 1st which is resulting in transactions remaining on Authorised status. Automated captures are captures automatically triggered by the Adyen platform instead of being created through our API or Customer Area.Concretely this incident affects merchants that have configured an automated "Capture Delay" for any of their merchant accounts as well as Point of Sale transactions.The incident has been resolved for new captures processed after 14:29 CEST. Merchants that manually capture through the API or the Customer Area are unaffected by the incident altogether.Our development team is urgently working to recapture the affected transactions. We will provide a new update as soon as it becomes available.Please contact Adyen Support (support@adyen.com) in case you have additional questions.)

august.title: Issues processing new co-badged Bancontact/Visa Debit cards
services: Classic Checkout SDKs Classic Direct API
Sale Classic Hosted Payment Pages HPP Drop
august.raw: Resolved(One of Belgium’s major banks started issuing new Bancontact cards co-badged with Visa debit, replacing existing Maestro co-badged cards.  We have noticed acceptance issues for these new cards on some integrations, with instances such as shoppers being unable to enter card details, or being unable to select which card scheme is used.  We have identified a merchant account on this company account that is accepting Bancontact payments. Currently the following integrations are affected:  - Classic Checkout SDKs- Classic Direct API integration - Dependent on merchant implementation- Drop-in / Components below versions: 4.2.0 (Web)- API-only - Dependent on merchant implementation  We have not found any issues for merchants using the following integrations:  - Point of Sale- Classic Hosted Payment Pages (HPP)- Drop-in / Components above the versions previously listed- Pay by Link- Drop-in / Components on iOS and Android  The new Bancontact cards are co-badged with Visa and a key difference is that they have a 16-digit card number (PAN), whereas this used to be 17 with Maestro.  For more information on the issues and ways in which you can fix this please visit the Adyen Docs page linked below. It is always strongly advised to move to the latest version of any integration: https://docs.adyen.com/payment-methods/bancontact/co-badged-cards)

september.title: Intermittent connectivity issues starting at 10:17 CEST
september.raw:
Resolved(This incident can be considered as resolved.  Our technical teams continue to monitor the situation and we will update you further should it be necessary.  Please follow new updates through our Status Page (www.adyen.com/status).)
Updated(The identified internal database issue starting at 10:17 CEST has been successfully contained as of 10:43 CEST.  Connectivity latency for merchants connecting to Adyen’s European and US endpoints has now returned back to normal.  A subset of modifications (such as refunds, captures and third party payouts) continue to experience some processing delays.  Payment processing is not affected by this incident.  We will make sure to share a follow-up update as soon as it becomes available.  Please follow new updates through our Status Page (www.adyen.com/status).)
Identified(We have identified an internal database issue starting at 10:17 CEST that will be noticeable to merchants. We are currently observing higher than usual latency in the EU and US region.  As a result, Adyen's Customer Area (ca-live.adyen.com), notifications service, risks checks and onboarding of new point of sale terminals will be temporarily unavailable. Due to this incident, modifications (such as refunds, captures and third party payouts) and reports may be processed with a delay.  Payment processing is not affected by this incident.  Our engineering team has been engaged and is urgently working on resolving this issue.  Please follow new updates through our Status Page (www.adyen.com/status).)

september.raw:

We will provide a further update at 14:00 CEST  Please contact Adyen Support (support@adyen.com) in case you have additional questions.)

october.title: Performance issue in the US starting at 17:45 CET
october.raw:
Resolved(Connectivity to US endpoints has fully recovered since 20:48 CEST.  We will continue monitoring closely and provide a new update if required.  Please follow new updates through our Status page (www.adyen.com/status).)
Updated(Connectivity to US endpoints continues to be recovered since 20:48 CEST.  Our engineering team continues to monitor this issue closely.  We will provide a new update in the next 15 minutes.  Please follow new updates through our Status page (www.adyen.com/status).)
Updated(Connectivity to US endpoints for all requests has significantly improved since 20:48 CEST.  Our engineering team is urgently working to resolve this issue.  We will provide a new update in the next 15 minutes.  Please follow new updates through our Status page (www.adyen.com/status).)
Updated(We continue experiencing issues for merchants connecting to US endpoints. This includes merchants and stores based in Canada, as well as any other merchants connecting to the Adyen platform using US region endpoints.  Connectivity to US endpoints for non-idempotent requests has started to recovered since 20:30 CEST.  Merchants who don’t make use of Adyen’s idempotency service and who don’t have a local US configuration for Risk and Recurring requests, can attempt to use alternative EU region endpoints for connecting to the Adyen platform. Region specific endpoints can be found in the Customer Area in the following page:  https://ca-live.adyen.com/ca/ca/config/accountapi.shtml Our engineering team is urgently working to resolve this issue.  At the moment we don’t have an ETA for when this will be resolved.  We will provide a new update in the next 15 minutes.  Please follow new updates through our Status page (www.adyen.com/status).)

november.title: Adyen - Report generation delay
services: Payments Accounting Report Received Payments Report Dispute Report
november.raw:
Resolved(The backlog of queued reports has now been cleared and reports are once again being processed normally.  Once a report is available for download, we will send a server-to-server notification with eventCode=REPORT_AVAILABLE. At that moment, the report will also be available for download from the Finance section in the Customer Area.  If you continue to have issues with report generation please reach out to Adyen Support (support@adyen.com).)
Updated(Our systems continue to work through the backlog for these reports.  We will provide new updates on the backlog as they become available. A subsequent update will be posted at 20:00 CET.  Please follow new updates through our Status Page (www.adyen.com/status).)
Identified(We are currently experiencing a generation delay for automatically scheduled reports and manually requested reports via our Customer Area.  The primary affected reports are:  - Payments Accounting Report- Received Payments Report- Dispute Report  In the case of automatically generated reports, it is not required to manually request reports from our Customer Area.  Once the report is available for download, we will send a server-to-server notification with eventCode=REPORT_AVAILABLE. At that moment, the report will also be available for download from the Finance section in the Customer Area.  We will provide a further update at 18:00 CEST  Please contact Adyen Support (support@adyen.com) in case you have additional questions.)

december.title: Apache Log4j Vulnerability - No impact to the Adyen platform
december.raw:
Resolved(During last week, starting Tuesday December 14th 2021, new vulnerabilities were found in the Apache Log4j library versions 2.15.0 and 2.16.0.  The identified vulnerabilities could be potentially exploited to allow an attacker perform remote code execution, leak sensitive information or perform a denial of service attack in the affected systems.  The advisories for the affected Log4j versions can be found below:- Version 2.15.0: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-45046- Version 2.16.0: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-45105 When the reports for both vulnerabilities were published, Adyen assessed the impact within the next hours and concluded that our platform is not vulnerable due to the very specific conditions that require to be met so that these vulnerabilities can be exploited.  In order to further reduce risks and unknown attack vectors, on December 15th 2021, the Adyen platform was upgraded to Apache Log4j version 2.16.0, and by December 21st 2021, the Adyen platform will be fully upgraded to Apache Log4j version 2.17.0.  We are not at risk of breach nor impacted by these two vulnerabilities.  Please contact Adyen Support (support@adyen.com) in case you have any questions.)
Resolved(On Friday, December 10th 2021, a vulnerability in the Apache Log4j library was detected by the National Institute for Standards and Technologies (NIST), potentially affecting systems running Apache Log4j - allowing an attacker to execute code on a remote server.  You may have seen press reports on this already:- NIST: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-44228- Apache: https://logging.apache.org/log4j/2.x/security.html When we first discovered a report of the vulnerability, prior to the above publication by the NIST, we immediately began testing our platform. We concluded that our core platform was not vulnerable. The platform and supporting systems were upgraded hours later to account for this vulnerability.  We are not currently at risk of breach via the above vulnerability.  Please contact Adyen Support (support@adyen.com) in case you have any questions.)

Resolved(The accessibility issue affecting the loading of report views when selected from the navigation bar within the Customer Area has now been resolved.Report views can now be accessed from the direct links available within the navigation bar sections.Please contact Adyen Support (support@adyen.com) in case you have additional questions.)
Identified(We have identified an accessibility issue affecting the loading of report views when being selected from the navigation bar within the Customer Area.  As a result, report views will temporarily only be available to merchants through the “See all charts and exports” link at the bottom of each navigation bar section.  Our engineering team has been engaged and is working on resolving this issue.  Please contact Adyen Support (support@adyen.com) in case you have additional questions.)

february.title: Payments Accounting report issue
february.raw:
Resolved(The identified data quality issue affecting scheduled reports has now been resolved. Merchants can expect the impacted reports generated on February 24th, 25th, 26th and 27th to be automatically regenerated today. We will send a server-to-server notification (with eventCode=REPORT_AVAILABLE) once the reports are available. The corrected reports will also be available for manual download within the Reports section in the Customer Area.)
Identified(We have identified a data quality issue for Payment Accounting reports generated after February 24th. Our development teams are engaged and working to resolve this issue.  We will provide an update on this issue as soon as it becomes available.  Please contact Adyen Support (support@adyen.com) in case you have additional questions.)

march.title: Temporary technical issue at the central European clearing house on March 16th
march.raw: Resolved(The European real-time gross settlement system (TARGET2) has informed us that they have experienced a technical issue which has now been resolved.  As a result, some merchants may see euro payouts corresponding to March 16th 2020 being credited to their account later than usual. With the information available at this point in time, we expect euro payouts corresponding to March 16th 2020 to be available to merchants today.  This is an issue outside the Adyen platform.  Please contact Adyen Support (support@adyen.com) in case you have additional questions.)

june.title: Redirect payments - Degraded performance
june.raw:
Resolved(The issue impacting the performance of our redirect payment services has been resolved from 23:40 CEST.Transactions requiring to redirect shoppers to other websites in order to complete their transactions were affected during the window of this incident.)
Identified(We have identified an issue starting at 17:00 CEST resulting in degraded performance for our redirect payment services.As a result, shoppers who are redirected to other websites in order to complete payments may not be able to conclude their transactions starting at this time.Our development team has been engaged and is urgently working to resolve this issue. We will provide an update in the next 30 minutes.Please contact Adyen Support (support@adyen.com) in case you have additional questions.)

june.title: PayPal - PayPal users can't login
june.raw:
Resolved(Paypal has informed us that the issues related to logging in on their platform is resolved. Paypal users should be able to login again when making a payment.  Please contact Adyen Support (support@adyen.com) in case you have additional questions.)
Identified(We have identified an issue outside of our platform resulting in PayPal users who are not able to login their PayPal accounts. PayPal users may be encountering timeouts or errors while attempting to login or when making a payment.  PayPal is aware of the issue and is actively working on resolving it.  Please contact Adyen Support (support@adyen.com) in case you have any questions.)

october.title: External 3D Secure performance issue
october.raw:
Resolved(The reported issue resulting in lower authentication success rates and elevated authentication response times for 3D Secure transactions is now resolved. Service has returned to normal and messages are processing as expected.  Please contact Adyen Support (support@adyen.com) in case you have any questions.)
Updated(The reported issue resulting in lower authentication success rates and elevated authentication response times for 3D Secure transactions processed by a limited number of Issuers is ongoing.  We will provide new updates as they become available.  Please contact Adyen Support (support@adyen.com) in case you have any questions.)
Updated(The reported issue resulting in lower authentication success rates and elevated authentication response times for 3D Secure transactions processed by a limited number of Issuers is ongoing.  To reiterate, we have confirmed that an external 3D Secure service provider used by multiple issuers is aware of the issue and is working to resolve it as soon as possible.  Merchants that require 3D Secure authentication using RevenueProtect (using the No Liability Shift Status risk check) may also be observing a higher than usual authorization cancellation rate for the affected transactions.  We will provide new updates as they become available.  Please contact Adyen Support (support@adyen.com) in case you have any questions.)
Updated(The reported issue resulting in lower authentication success rates and elevated authentication response times for 3D Secure transactions processed by a limited number of Issuers is ongoing.  We have confirmed that an external 3D Secure service provider used by multiple issuers is aware of the issue and is working to resolve it as soon as possible.  Merchants that require 3D Secure authentication using RevenueProtect (using the No Liability Shift Status risk check) may also be observing a higher than usual authorization cancellation rate for the affected transactions.  We will provide new updates as they become available.  Please contact Adyen Support (support@adyen.com) in case you have any questions.)
Identified(We have identified an issue outside of our platform starting at 14:40 CEST that may be resulting in lower authentication success rates and elevated authentication response times for 3D Secure transactions processed by a limited number of Issuers (Issuers from United Kingdom, Ireland and Netherlands have been identified as most affected).  Merchants that require 3D Secure authentication using RevenueProtect (using the No Liability Shift Status risk check) may also be observing a higher than usual authorization cancellation rate for the affected transactions.  We are closely monitoring the situation and will provide new updates as they become available.  Please contact Adyen Support (support@adyen.com) in case you have any questions.)

november.raw:

We have already escalated this matter and closely monitoring the situation and will provide new updates as they become available.  Please contact Adyen Support (support@adyen.com) in case you have any questions.)
Identified(We have identified an issue outside of our platform starting at 8:50 PST that may be resulting in lower authentication success rates and elevated authentication response times for 3D Secure transactions processed by a limited number of Issuers (Issuers from Sweden, the United Kingdom, Norway, Denmark, the Netherlands, and Belgium have been identified as most affected).  Merchants that require 3D Secure authentication using RevenueProtect (using the No Liability Shift Status risk check) may also be observing a higher than usual authorization cancellation rate for the affected transactions.  We are closely monitoring the situation and will provide new updates as they become available.  Please contact Adyen Support (support@adyen.com) in case you have any questions.)

december.title: Daily Finance Report generation delay December 8th 2020
december.raw:
Resolved(We have resolved the issue resulting in generation delays for the Daily Finance Reports from December 8th (reporting date December 7th).  A server-to-server notification with eventCode=“REPORT_AVAILABLE" has been sent and the file is available for download from the Finance section in the Customer Area.  Note that other daily scheduled reports and on demand reports are not affected by this issue.  Please contact Adyen Support (support@adyen.com) in case you have additional questions.)
Identified(We have identified an issue resulting in generation delays for the Daily Finance Reports from December 8th (reporting date December 7th).  Our development team has been engaged and is working on resolving this incident.  A new update will be provided as soon as more information becomes available. We will send a server-to-server notification with eventCode=“REPORT_AVAILABLE" once the report is available. At that moment the file will also be available for download from the Finance section in the Customer Area.  Note that other daily scheduled reports and on demand reports are not affected by this issue.  Please contact Adyen Support (support@adyen.com) in case you have additional questions.)
